title: `yarn build` step of `docker-compose build` failing (exit code: 137)

labels.name: C-meta
labels.description: Category: Meta discussion about this repository, git hygiene, issues, etc

body:

Something related to yarn build causes `docker-compose build` to fail

**To Reproduce**

1. clone optimism repo
2. follow readme up to "integration tests"
3. `cd` into `ops` folder, set env vars and try `docker-compose build`

**Expected behavior**
Docker compose to build the images so I can run the containers locally

**System Specs:**
 - OS: Mac OS Big Sur
 - commit hash: `2d63f2f94ab2ba3ec3ee8bc038a11260a09f240c`
Code 137 indicates that the process is out of memory. How much memory did you allocate to Docker on your machine?
Looks like my default docker desktop allocation was only 2gb. Increased it and it built successfully. Thanks a lot 🤝

For anyone else who may stumble upon this, try removing old containers to make room before increasing your docker memory allocation and allowing your laptop to take flight 🚀 
`docker system prune -a`
